page.title: 09The New People of Wellington
page.content: Wellington and its surroundings has the largest ethnic population in Shropshire.Asians and West Indians arrived in the early 1950's.They settled here because of the good job opportunities. The immigrants here feel they are Salopians,for the third generation,who are now entering the schools,were born in the local hospital,and are truly British.However they do still maintain many of their ancestors' customs. The Mosque on Tan Bank,once a Methodist Chapel,reflects the change in the population and their beliefs. The old Hadley School,which closed in 1973,is now a Sikh Temple. The old established Christian churches are still thriving,Non_ Conformist,C of E,Mormons,the Gospel Church and the Spiritualist Church are all represented in this area.
